customer_addr:
N9463 county road H
Elkhart Lake, WI 53020

citations.narrative:
While observing the bison in their enclosure, I asked if the two bison had ever escaped onto the road. The licensee stated
that there was a day recently where he had the service doors to the enclosure open while he was inside working and on
the tractor. He stated that he was aware that both bison were grazing in the yard and that he saw them wander up the
driveway to the road. He stated that he got into his truck and followed them down the road to where he could use voice
commands to turn them around and follow them home. He stated that the bison did not encounter any people or vehicles,
returned home uninjured, and that they were on the road for less than 10 minutes total.
Allowing animals to wander freely around the property where they can get to the road does not protect them from harm or
injury. Running loose down the road puts them at risk of being injured by an automobile. Additionally, large animals such
as bison, can cause damage to property and vehicles can become injured when spooked attempting to be caught.
Correct starting on 4/20/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
While observing the bison in their enclosure, I asked if the two bison had ever escaped onto the road. The licensee stated 
that there was a day recently where he had the service doors to the enclosure open while he was inside working and on 
the tractor.  He stated that he was aware that both bison were grazing in the yard and that he saw them wander up the 
driveway to the road. He stated that he got into his truck and followed them down the road to where he could use voice 
commands to turn them around and follow them home. He stated that the bison did not encounter any people or vehicles, 
returned home uninjured, and that they were on the road for less than 10 minutes total.  
 
Allowing animals to wander freely around the property where they can get to the road does not protect them from harm or 
injury. Running loose down the road puts them at risk of being injured by an automobile. Additionally, large animals such 
as bison, can cause damage to property and vehicles can become injured when spooked attempting to be caught.  
 
Correct starting on 4/20/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

n
